name: Le Male Elixir 2-Piece Gift Set
categories: Fragrance, Value & Gift Sets, Perfume Gift Sets
about: Fragrance Family:Earthy & Woody.Scent Type:Warm Woods.Key Notes:Lavender, Benzoin, Tonka Bean.Set Description:This festive season, Le Male Elixir is taking us to the Jean Paul Gaultier Museum. Inside, discover the amber- and gold-streaked bottle and its aromatic, amber-scented shower gel..About the Bottle:With a flamboyant stroke of artistic genius, Jean-Paul has reimagined Perugino's Saint Sebastian, breathing new life and transforming him into a charismatic Gaultier man dressed in his finest kilt. Lift the lid of this stylishly framed gift set and get ready to experience its dazzlingly seductive powers with its amber- and gold-streaked bottle and aromatic, amber-scented shower gel. Give the most seductive gift of all!.About the Fragrance:Woody aromatic-amber notes define this intense fragrance. Just one torrid spritz of this woody aromatic-amber elixir is enough to set the senses on fire to the point of addiction. Ablaze with sensuality. Intense on the skin. Sunny, tropical tonka bean gravitates toward legendary lavender. The animal magnetism of seductive benzoin. A blast of fresh mint and bergamot. Now, you’re ready! You’re melting with desire..This Set Contains:- 4.3 oz/ 125 mL Le Male Elixir
ingredients: Le Male Elixir:.Alcohol Denat., Parfum (Fragrance), Aqua (Water), Linalool, Coumarin, Limonene, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone, Cinnamal, Citral, Geraniol, Benzyl Benzoate, Benzyl Alcohol...Le Male Elixir Shower Gel:.Aqua (Water), Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Coco-Glucoside, Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate, Parfum (Fragrance), Caprylyl/Capryl Glucoside, Lauryl Glucoside, Citric Acid, Glycerin, Sodium Benzoate, Propylene Glycol, Linalool, Sodium Gluconate, Coumarin, Glyceryl Caprylate, Polyglyceryl-6 Oleate, Limonene, Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone, Sodium Surfactin.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Fragrance is intensified by the warmth of your own body. Apply in the creases of your knees and elbows for a longer-lasting, stronger scent. .-After applying, avoid rubbing or dabbing skin. This breaks down the fragrance, causing it to wear off more quickly. .-If you prefer placing fragrance on your wrists, be sure to reapply after frequent handwashing, as this tends to rinse off the scent. .-Replace fragrance after 12 months. Expired perfumes more than a year old lose the integrity of the original scent.
